Author: tigerchik
Text: I worked out while recovering and gaining weight - I went from 93 lbs to 115, lifting and cardio all the while. My doctor and parents were fine with it as long as I was gaining weight. The exercise was supervised by a run coach. I think if you LIKE to work out and are medically stable, lifting is a really great way to gain some weight - and FEEL strong.

Author: NewBullMoose
Text: My doctor told me strength training is actually really good for you during recovery (obviously don't go crazy with it but it seems you've got a handle on that anyways). Not only will it help with muscle and general body acceptance, apparently it can be good for your bones too, something lots of ED sufferers desperately need.
